title: How to disconnect broadband and retain the phone connection - Quora

response.answer_text: Two possibilities, is your broadband cable connected, or phone service (DSL) connected? If cable, you may have separate modems for internet and voice, but usually for home service, they would be a combined unit. If DSL pretty much same answer. It would be a combo internet/voice modem. If you DO have separate modems (one for internet, one for voice), you could just disconnect the internet modem.

Call your provider and tell them that you want phone without internet. (Since the phone is really VoIP to the phone company they use, it’s still going over a portion of the internet, but you won’t be able to connect a computer to the internet any longer.)
